channel.title: King on Tristan Berchoux
channel.description: Recent content in King on Tristan Berchoux

item.title: The value of re-analysis
item.description: I just saw this really nice post over on John Cook’s blog. He talks about how it is a valuable exercise to re-type code for examples you find in a book or on a blog. I completely agree that this is a good way to learn through osmosis, learn about debugging, and often pick up the reasons for particular coding tricks (this is how I learned about vectorized calculations in Matlab, by re-typing and running my advisors code back in my youth).
